summary: Expand the Valentine invitation website with cinema-grade interactive animations, add romantic background music, and include a proposal moment/flow (photos/montage removed from scope).
known_issues: User-uploaded photo is not visible / not being added to the site as expected.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine invitation website that asks the user's girlfriend to be their valentine, featuring a prominent large heartfelt letter as the main content and clear call-to-action buttons.

Add cinematic animations to the page: an on-load sequence for the letter and background, and animated interactions for the CTA buttons (hover, press, and click), using smooth easing and staggered motion.

Implement button outcomes with cinematic feedback: clicking “Yes” transitions to a celebratory scene/message, while clicking “No” produces a playful, non-harsh response that keeps the experience romantic.
Apply a cohesive romantic visual theme (distinct colors, typography, spacing, and layout) and use it consistently across the page components and animations.
Add the required generated images to the project as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI (background/illustration and favicon).

Replace the current short letter content in the Valentine invitation letter with a single cohesive heartfelt English letter of approximately 500 words, keeping the final main question “Will you be my Valentine?” as the prominent call-to-action line on the letter.

Add the 6 user-uploaded photos as static frontend assets and render them in a new interactive, cinematic “memories” photo montage section/scene (not just a plain grid). The montage must include smooth transitions (e.g., crossfade + subtle zoom/parallax) and support both desktop and mobile.

Pair each displayed photo in the montage with a different romantic English message (short, heartfelt, and unique per photo) and present the message as an animated overlay/caption that appears in sync with the photo transition.

Upgrade the overall page to feel more “cinema grade” and interactive by adding tasteful cinematic effects (e.g., film grain overlay, vignette, light leaks/bokeh/particles, and/or subtle parallax layers) that enhance the existing romantic theme without hurting performance or readability.

Add a proposal moment/flow after the Valentine “Yes” path: transition from the current “Yes” outcome into a proposal scene that culminates in a clear proposal question in English (e.g., “Will you marry me?”) with interactive buttons and cinematic feedback.
Remove the “Memories” photo montage scene from the Valentine site so no user photos are shown anywhere in the UI.
Update the Valentine flow so that the “Yes” outcome’s Continue action transitions directly to the proposal scene (skipping any photo/memories step).

Remove montage-specific code and styling that is no longer used after deleting the photo montage (component, imports, and montage CSS rules), ensuring the app builds cleanly with no unused-scene references.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine invitation website asking the user's girlfriend to be their valentine, featuring a large letter, cinematic animations, and interactive buttons.
Write and display a large heartfelt main letter with approximately 500 words as the primary content of the Valentine invitation page.
Upgrade the experience to a more interactive, cinema-grade style and include a proposal moment/flow in addition to the Valentine ask.
Add romantic background music to deepen the cinematic feel, with user-friendly controls (play/pause, mute/volume) and mobile-safe autoplay behavior.

projectName: Romantic Valentine invitation website with big letter, cinematic animations, and interactive buttons
